PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

### PR summary [92c914a8cf](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13761/commits/92c914a8cf519f9ccbc2586097c5b3c6c091d13e)

`+ _root_.MeasurableEmbedding.rnDeriv_map_aux`
`+ _root_.MeasurableEmbedding.sigmaFinite_map`

`+ absolutelyContinuous_map`

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9538211929/job/26287144195)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9538211929/job/26287143976)
I'm not sure I get this comment: in this section, `f` is always a measurable embedding, so it should map sigma-finite measures to sigma-finite measures, right?

Yes they are of course all sigma-finite. I was PRing a bunch of code I had lying around, saw the weird IsFiniteMeasure hypothesis in this and wrote too quickly about a possible explanation.
This is now fixed.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: absolute continuity, Radon-Nikodym derivatives of `μ.map f` for a measurable embedding `f`
